perturbation.original_text:
3.5      Payments: As defined in section 3.3 above, selling parties may
                  owe the other party some portion of the Proceeds. The payment
                  of amounts owed shall be performed as follows:
                  3.5.1    Payments due shall be made within 45 days of the
                           close of each calendar quarter.
                  3.5.2    Payments that are not received within thirty (30)
                           days after their due date will bear interest at the
                           rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded
                           monthly from the due date until such payment is
                           received.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5      Payments: As defined in section 3.3 above, selling parties may
                  owe the other party some portion of the Proceeds. The payment
                  of amounts owed shall be performed as follows:
                  3.5.1    Payments due shall be made within 60 days of the
                           close of each calendar quarter.
                  3.5.2    Payments that are not received within thirty (30)
                           days after their due date will bear interest at the
                           rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded
                           monthly from the due date until such payment is
                           received.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict regarding the payment deadline. Section 3.5.1 initially states that payments are due within 45 days of the close of each calendar quarter. However, the modified version extends this period to 60 days. This creates a contradiction because Section 3.5.2 says that payments not received within 30 days after the *original* due date will bear interest. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes, as it's unclear whether interest applies after 30 days from the original 45-day deadline or the extended 60-day deadline.

perturbation.original_text:
3.5.2    Payments that are not received within thirty (30)
                           days after their due date will bear interest at the
                           rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded
                           monthly from the due date until such payment is
                           received.
                  3.5.3    Payments not received within sixty (60) days after
                           their due date will be considered a material breach
                           of this Agreement and the party due payment may
                           pursue any and all legal action to recover the
                           payment and reasonable legal fees incurred in the
                           pursuit of said payment.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5.2    Payments that are not received within fifteen (15)
                           days after their due date will bear interest at the
                           rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded
                           monthly from the due date until such payment is
                           received.
                  3.5.3    Payments not received within forty-five (45) days after
                           their due date will be considered a material breach
                           of this Agreement and the party due payment may
                           pursue any and all legal action to recover the
                           payment and reasonable legal fees incurred in the
                           pursuit of said payment.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates contradictory payment terms. It changes Section 3.5.2 to impose interest on payments not received within 15 days, while concurrently altering Section 3.5.3 to consider payments a material breach only after 45 days. This inconsistency creates confusion as it subjects late payments to interest charges much sooner than they would be deemed a material breach, leading to potential disputes over the interpretation and enforcement of these clauses.

perturbation.original_text:
7.2      All actions, cases, suits and proceedings in connection with
                  this Agreement shall be brought in Maryland. All persons
                  affected by this Agreement specifically consent to the
                  personal jurisdiction of and venue in said courts. No action,
                  case, suit or proceeding, regardless of form, arising out of
                  or related to this Agreement, may be brought by either party
                  more than one (1) year after the cause of action has arisen,
                  or in the case of nonpayment, more than two (2) years from the
                  date of the last payment.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.2      All actions, cases, suits and proceedings in connection with
                  this Agreement shall be brought in Maryland. All persons
                  affected by this Agreement specifically consent to the
                  personal jurisdiction of and venue in said courts. No action,
                  case, suit or proceeding, regardless of form, arising out of
                  or related to this Agreement, may be brought by either party
                  more than two (2) year after the cause of action has arisen,
                  or in the case of nonpayment, more than one (1) years from the
                  date of the last payment.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces conflicting statute of limitations. The original text states a one-year limitation for general actions and a two-year limit for nonpayment. The modified version swaps these limitations, creating ambiguity about the time frame for filing lawsuits, especially regarding payment-related disputes. This contradictory information could lead to legal challenges and uncertainty about the enforceability of claims.
